result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shea Dustin Hoffmann

records.addlTxt:
Standard conditions:
Add'l conditions:
Comply with sex offender registry.
Deft. got ahold of public defenders office and does not qualify. Deft. filled out petition for court appt. counsel and provided to the Clerk.

3:24 PM Defendant Shea Dustin Hoffmann in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews charges and penalties with Defendant. Advised of rights. Complaint received, waived reading. Court finds probable cause. 
Defendant wants counsel. Court goes off the record to allow deft. to call public defenders office to see if he qualifies- 3:28 PM. 
Court recalls- 3:35 PM. 
Deft unable to get ahold of public defenders office. 
Deft. request a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
